The Lecithin-sphingomyelin ratio is an important test for assessing fetal lung maturity, which is crucial in cases of diabetic mothers as they are at higher risk of having babies with respiratory distress syndrome.

Phosphatidyl glycerol is a component of the lecithin-sphingomyelin ratio and is also known as lung maturity index.
